doc.field: Susan E. Wilson Collection on the American Peoples School
Susan E. Wilson Collection on the American Peoples School

Susan E. Wilson's mother, Vivian Glenn Wilson, lived at the American Peoples School in the 1930s. The school, located at 67 Stevenson Place in the Bronx, was a progressive residential center for young men and women who work during the day and study in the evening. The Susan E. Wilson Collection on the American Peoples School (dated 1933-1937) consists of materials collected by Wilson's parents documenting the culture and politics of the American Peoples School in the Bronx. Materials include a blank membership application, ephemera, dance instructions, and a research paper. The collection also includes theater programs from the 1930s, many from the WPA Federal Theatre Project.

Susan E. Wilson's mother, Vivian Glenn Wilson, lived at the American Peoples School in the 1930s. The school, located at 67 Stevenson Place in the Bronx, was a progressive residential center for young men and women who work during the day and study in the evening.
Donated by Susan E. Wilson in February 2022; the accession number associated with this gift is 2022.020.
